submission:
class Solution:
    def countOfPairs(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        n = len(nums)
        dp = [1] * (nums[0] + 1)
        # print(dp)
        for col in range(1, n):
            new_dp = [0] * (nums[col] + 1)
            row_start = max(nums[col] - nums[col - 1], 0)
            accum = 0
            for row in range(row_start, nums[col] + 1):
                if row - row_start <= nums[col - 1]: # NOTE 1: Didn't have this logic with the `- row_start` at first.
                    accum += dp[row - row_start]
                new_dp[row] = accum
            dp = new_dp
            # print(dp)
        return sum(dp) % 1_000_000_007 # NOTE 2: Forgot to mod.
